item.title: Can large language models identify and correct their mistakes? | Google AI Blog
item.description: Posted by Gladys Tyen, Intern, Google Research LLMs are increasingly popular for reasoning tasks, such as multi-turn QA, task completion, code generation, or mathematics. Yet much like people, the...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Gladys Tyen, Intern, Google Research LLMs are increasingly popular for reasoning tasks, such as multi-turn QA, task completion, code generation, or mathematics. Yet much like people, they do not always solve problems correctly on the first try, especially on tasks for which they were not trained. Therefore, for such systems to be most useful, they should be able to 1) identify where their reasoning went wrong and 2) backtrack to find another solution. This has led to a surge in ...

item.content:encoded: Image: Hudson Soft/Konami Limited Run Games and Konami are teaming up Konami, which is digging into its back catalog in a major way in 2024, is reissuing a handful of classic platformers from the 8-bit and 16-bit eras with the help of Limited Run Games. Two collections, one focused on Felix the Cat and another on Rocket Knight, will arrive this year on PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, and Nintendo Switch. The Felix the Cat collection will include the eponymous NES and Game Boy games released by H...

item.content:encoded: Image: Ubisoft Montpellier via Polygon Waiting for Silksong or another 2D Metroid? Get this one Prince of Persia: The Lost Crown is the rare video game that has me excitedly Googling and ending up in research rabbit holes because of the world‚Äôs lore and the inspirations it‚Äôs pulling from. Did you know, for instance, that the Immortals ‚Äî which you may know from the movie 300 ‚Äî were a real-life heavy infantry unit in ancient Persia, made up of fighters trained from the age of 5? item.content:encoded: Posted by Ay√ßa √áakmakli, UX Lead, Google Research, Responsible AI and Human Centered Technology Team Google‚Äôs Responsible AI User Experience (Responsible AI UX) team is a product-minded team embedded within Google Research. This unique positioning requires us to apply responsible AI development practices to our user-centered user experience (UX) design process. In this post, we describe the importance of UX design and responsible AI in product development, and share a few examples of how our...

item.title: How Multimodality Makes LLM Alignment More Challenging | KDnuggets
item.description: The addition of multimodal abilities to ChatGPT via GPT-4 allows users to use images and text together, expanding its functions but posing new challenges. Aligning this mix of data demands careful cur...
item.content:encoded: The addition of multimodal abilities to ChatGPT via GPT-4 allows users to use images and text together, expanding its functions but posing new challenges. Aligning this mix of data demands careful curation and presents ethical considerations, requiring developers to obtain high-quality training data and navigate complex issues for ethical alignment.
